attributes.action: Prevent building works on Meirs last greenfield site.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many existing brown field sites at this end of the city alone Why take the only green space in Meir.  re-generating a dead brown field site into a hub for education & learning is more beneficial to our city.

 The area has long been used as open green space & playing fields since late 1800s it’s well used and enjoyed by vast amounts of residents benefiting mental and physical health.  air quality is already in the 95th percentile - help protect the health of future generations.
attributes.background:
Stop the planned building on meirs last green field site.
Protect the  Badger setts, Fox Earths, nesting Buzzards,

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to prohibit any new development of greenfield land, if that's something you'd like to happen.
